wikipedia_page.main: Samuel Nicholson Kingdon (16 May 1805 – 17 March 1872) was an English cricketer with amateur status. He was associated with Cambridge University and made his first-class debut in 1827.He was educated at Eton College and at Trinity College, Cambridge. He later became a fellow of Sidney Sussex College, Cambridge and was vicar of Bridgerule, where his father had also been vicar, from 1844 to his death in 1872.
